result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:20 PM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence Jean Broeren in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant JOSEPH D HALL in court.  Attorney Lester H Liptak, as friend of the court, in court for JOSEPH D HALL. Attorney waives reading of complaint. Defendant is informed of charges. Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint. Defendant to apply for public defender and advised of county appointment process. Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court  and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions.
Not to possess or consume any alcohol.
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Not to drive without a valid driver's license.
Not to drive with any alcohol m system
